EcoTrack:

Take the Next Step, to Leave Less Behind

Introducing EcoTrack: your family's eco-friendly assistant! ðŸŒ± Our platform helps you securely manage and predict your carbon footprint by analyzing everything from energy usage to transportation habits. Think of it as having a personal eco-coach cheering you onâ€”without the intimidating gym memberships!

Imagine this: youâ€™re chilling at home when EcoTrack nudges you about your energy usage spiking! ðŸ“ˆ You check the dashboard, which reveals which appliances are guzzling power like theyâ€™re at an all-you-can-eat buffet. I created this together with my friends Rajveer Dharkar and Ishaan Cherukuri during the 10th Aniversary of the 24-hour University of Maryland(Baltimore County) Hackathon(HackUMBC 2024)!

Portfolio Website

Portfolio Website

I built this personal portfolio website to practice my skills in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript while showcasing my progress in computer science. This project helped me learn more about front-end web development, including responsive design, layout techniques, and user experience.

Creating the site allowed me to apply what I've learned and explore new tools and methods to improve my design and coding abilities. I wanted a space to not only track my growth but also share my work with others as I continue developing new projects.

Website

EcoTrack

EcoTrack

EcoTrack is a web app I developed to calculate carbon footprints and raise awareness about environmental impact. While building it, I enhanced my understanding of JavaScript, APIs, and data handling, which were essential for creating the interactive features and tracking results.

This project allowed me to dive deeper into problem-solving and user interface design, making the app intuitive and easy to use. I created EcoTrack to combine my passion for coding with a cause I care about, helping users understand their carbon footprint and make more eco-conscious choices.
